summary: Higher, further, faster,
body:
Hearing Carol Danvers say

Higher, further, faster,

ba-by

turns me on SO MUCH and by the way Maria says

That’s right

all breathlessly and in love, I can tell she feels the same way

summary: So was anyone going to tell me that there’s a version of DC’s Captain Marvel who’s a Jewish girl in WWII whose magic word is...
body:
So was anyone going to tell me that there’s a version of DC’s Captain Marvel who’s a Jewish girl in WWII whose magic word is made by invoking the names of heroic Jewish women from the Torah

Or was I just supposed to find that out by myself

summary: Silence
title: Silence
body:
A teeny tiny thing I needed to write down somewhere.

Fandom: Captain Marvel (2019)

Pairing: Carol x Maria

Link AO3

They never talked about it, because they didn’t have to.

They don’t talk about it. They don’t talk about how well Carol fits in her life. About how well she takes up the mantel – never really worn – of co-parent to Monica.

They especially never speak of how well their hands fit together – never too long, never too public, but still there.

There’s really no point putting a name on the nights when Carol is so taken by Maria’s smile that she can’t resist kissing her over and over.

No point addressing Carol being the one getting up to comfort Monica after a nightmare – and coming back to bed, embracing Maria, belonging.

They didn’t talk about it, because they didn’t have to.

So when the ghost of the woman she had given her heart to comes back from the dead six years later, she truly has no one to talk about it.

summary:
The real highlights of that article...
"Brie Larson has only just arrived on the scene as the long-awaited Carol Danvers, but...
body:
The real highlights of that article…

“Brie Larson has only just arrived on the scene as the long-awaited Carol Danvers, but with a seven-movie arc ahead of her, there’s plenty of time to explore her sexuality.”

[…]

“Considering Larson is set to replace Robert Downey Jr. and become the “new face” of the MCU, having an LGBTQ+ character at the forefront would mark a major milestone for the world’s highest-grossing franchise.”

Well for me who doesn’t know things. I’M FUCKING EXCITED!!!!

summary: Every interaction between Brie and RDJ is so wholesome. They clearly think so highly of each other. He is her biggest hype man...
body: Every interaction between Brie and RDJ is so wholesome. They clearly think so highly of each other. He is her biggest hype man and she obviously looks up to him since she will be taking the spot in the forefront of the MCU. I wish Tony was gonna stick around longer just so we could see him interact with Carol. They have some awesome comics moments (the awful Civil War 2 storyline notwithstanding) and I would love to see their brotp on screen.

blog.name: hellzyeahthewebwieldingavenger
blog.title: Hellz Yeah, Spider-Man: The Web Wielding Avenger
blog.description:
A blog all about my love for Peter Benjamin Parker, his friends, family, enemies and world in general. Expect images, rants, musings and long winded essays of the Web Head and why I think he's the greatest comic book Superhero of all time. 

I LOVE comments and questions so leave some as you pass by as well as call me on any facts I have gotten wrong.

Also check out my sub-pages for F.A.Q.s and a key for when I abbreviate.

summary: I rewatched Avengers 2012. Still the best MCU film frankly. It’s less jokey, less formulaic and less bathos riddled than more...
body:
I rewatched Avengers 2012. Still the best MCU film frankly. It’s less jokey, less formulaic and less bathos riddled than more modern MCU features.

But more poignantly it gave me yet another reason to dislike Captain Marvel.

Captain Marvel establishes Fury and Coulson knew of aliens way back in the 1990s but in Phase 1 in general and more specifically in Avengers they both act inconsistently with that idea.

Fury straight up says they’re developing the Phase 2 weapons specifically because of Thor and his confirmation of alien life.

summary: I saw Captain Marvel again with my nieces and nephew because I needed them to see her and witness a woman get knocked down and...
body: I saw Captain Marvel again with my nieces and nephew because I needed them to see her and witness a woman get knocked down and get back up again. My oldest niece saw that and cried. This is why this film is so fucking important. Even more so than Wonder Woman, not that I’m pitting them against one another. But unlike Diana, Carol wasn’t born from greatness. She had a shitty father, a hard childhood full of people constantly telling her she couldn’t do something because she was a girl, and was lied to by someone she thought cared about her. She came from nothing and made something of herself. Even before she had her powers, she was still powerful. I needed them to see that because this world will tell my nephew that he can’t have feelings and my niece that girls aren’t interested in STEM. Quality representation fucking matters. Point. Blank. Period.

But unlike Diana, Carol wasn’t born from greatness. She had a shitty father, a hard childhood full of people constantly telling her she couldn’t do something because she was a girl, and was lied to by someone she thought cared about her. She came from nothing and made something of herself. Even before she had her powers, she was still powerful. I needed them to see that because this world will tell my nephew that he can’t have feelings and my niece that girls aren’t interested in STEM. Quality representation fucking matters. Point. Blank. Period.

summary: #TAPReviews | "Captain Marvel"
title: #TAPReviews | "Captain Marvel"
body:
#TAPReviews takes a look at the new Captain in the @Marvel Cinematic Universe – @MarvelStudios’ @CaptainMarvel #EntertainmentonTAP

After the cataclysmic event in Avengers: Infinity War that garnered the colossal shift in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, the MCU has been putting out rather safe films out to fill the gap until Avengers: Endgame. And this is not to say the films like Ant-Man and the Wasp were terrible, but, obviously, it was not much to write home about, sadly.

And whilst the Wasp has been argued to steal…

View On WordPress

question: Imagine the post credit for Endgame is Carol talking to a Kree Starforce soldier wearing a Ravager coat that covers his uniform (Bryan Dechart) handcuffed to the side of a bed telling her that what he says is true and the Skrull Empire is targeting Earth. Cue Carol agreeing with him as he rises up excitedly saying she won't regret this as she turns behind him seeing that he burned through the handcuffs and melted the side of her bed as he apologizes to her with Carol referring to him as Genis.

summary:
After watching Captain Marvel
Me: let's get ice cream!
My brother: you can't have ice cream.
Me: why?
Bro: because you cried at...
body:
After watching Captain Marvel

Me: let’s get ice cream!

My brother: you can’t have ice cream.

Me: why?

Bro: because you cried at the Stan Lee tribute and the cameo too and the entire cinema heard it.

Me: … Okay yeah you got a point.

Black Widow and Captain Marvel are my girls. I’m also very gay for Carol/Brie and Natasha. Slytherin. Cat person. Bi af though more on the girl side of Bi. Mostly a marvel blog but memes, Harry Potter, Star Wars, and lots of random things end up on here too.

BFF @dermberlder
